socket.AF_INET ipv4 # socket.SOCK_STREAM tcp ``` 0.2 ```python socket.bind(('127.0.0.1',8080)) # targetport ``` 0.3 ```python socket.listen(5) # ``` 0.4 ```python while True: so,addr = socket.accept() # socket ``` ###### 1.socket 0.1 socket ```python client = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET,socket.SOCK_STREAM) ``` 0.2 ```python client.connect((target,port)) ``` ###### 2. ```python data = server.recv(1024) client.send(b'') ``` ###### 3. ###### 4. 2 ###### 5. ##### HTTP ###### Hyper Text Transfer Protocol ###### :http ###### Web : ![](https://images2018.cnblogs.com/blog/867021/201803/867021-20180322001733298-201433635.jpg) ```http GET / HTTP/1.1 Host: 127.0.0.1:8800 Connection: keep-alive sec-ch-ua: "Google Chrome";v="89", "Chromium";v="89", ";Not A Brand";v="99" sec-ch-ua-mobile: ?0 Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1 User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 11_2_3) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/89.0.4389.114 Safari/537.36 Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/avif,image/webp,image/apng,*/*;q=0.8,application/signed-exchange;v=b3;q=0.9 Sec-Fetch-Site: none Sec-Fetch-Mode: navigate Sec-Fetch-User: ?1 Sec-Fetch-Dest: document Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, br Accept-Language: zh-CN,zh;q=0.9 Cookie: hblid=LXa5cZvOpVbu5wDe3m39N0HIgrB8BFbo; csrftoken=NQ2jvGjSCUXBQsAU0TgOCoop939FrKCBhyPS7jAgHBlTEtpqgLOvOjZqirQ0gjeQ; security_level=0 \r\n ``` : ![](https://images2018.cnblogs.com/blog/867021/201803/867021-20180322001744323-654009411.jpg) ###### http80,https443 ###### 1xx , 2xx 200 3xx 4xx 403 404 5xx ###### GETHEADPOSTPUTDELETETRACEOPTIONSCONNECT ###### URL , *Protocol://Domain:Port/Path?Key1=Value1#Part* #### django ##### `pip3 install django -i https://pypi.tsinghua.edu.cn/simple` ##### `django-admin startproject PROJECT_NAME` [^]: settingsDIRS(Template) professional pycharmDjango [^]: pycharmdjango3,settings.pyimport os ##### ##### | djangoStudy ##### | __init__.py | asgi.py | settings.py | urls.py -> URL | | wsgi.py runserverwsgirefwebserver | manage.py | templates ##### `python3 manage.py runserver [[ip:]port]` Pycharmmanage.py ##### ```python from django.shortcuts import HttpResponse, render def index(request): # return HttpResponse('index') # return render(request, 'index.html') # urlpatterns = [ path('admin/', admin.site.urls), path('index/', index), ] ``` ##### ###### request *METHOD* *GET&POST* *GET&POST* `POST.get('Key') ` ###### redirect ```python from django.shortcuts import redirect def login(request): if True: return redirect(PATH) ``` ##### app ###### app `django-admin startapp APP_NAME` . | __init__.py | admin.py | apps.py app | migrations | | __init__.py | models.py | tests.py | views.py ###### ()app ```python INSTALLED_APPS = [ 'django.contrib.admin', 'django.contrib.auth', 'django.contrib.contenttypes', 'django.contrib.sessions', 'django.contrib.messages', 'django.contrib.staticfiles', # 'app1', 'app1.apps.App1Config', # ] ``` ##### app ###### views.py urls.py ```python from app1 import views urlpatterns = [ path('admin/', admin.site.urls), path('login/', views.login), path('login2/', views), path('index/', views.index) ] ``` ##### models.py ###### Orm , ###### models 1.settings.py ```python DATABASES = { 'default': { 'ENGINE': 'django.db.backends.sqlite3', 'NAME': BASE_DIR / 'db.sqlite3', } } ``` 2.models.pyorm -> -> () -> ```python class User(models.Model): # Model username = models.CharField(max_length=32) # varchar(32) password = models.CharField(max_length=32) ``` 3.`python3 manage.py makemigrations` app, 4.`python3 manage.py migrate ` , ##### ```python from app1 import models # models.User.objects.get(username=user, password=pwd) # get # filter models.User.objects.all().orderby('-id')#id if models.User.objects.filter(username=user, password=pwd): pass ``` ##### ```python from app1 import models models.User.objects.create(name=name) ``` ##### ```python from app1 import models models.User.objects.get(id=id).delete() ``` ##### ```python p = models.User.objects.filter(id=request.POST.get('id'))[0] p.name = 'xxx' p.save() ``` ##### mysql 1.mysql 2.settings.py ```python DATABASES = { 'default': { 'ENGINE': 'django.db.backends.mysql', 'NAME': 'login', 'HOST': 'localhost', 'PORT': 3306, 'USER': 'xxx', 'PASSWORD': 'xxx', } } import pymysql pymysql.install_as_MySQLdb() ``` 3.model 4. `python3 manage.py makemigrations` `Python3 manage.py migrate` ##### ```html {% for i in p_list %} {% endfor %}
id name
{{ forloop.counter }} {{ i.id }} {{ i.name }}
``` ```python return render(request, 'lists.html', context={'p_list': lists}) ``` #### Django ##### 1. `Pip3 install diango` diango `django-admin startproject` ###### `python3 manage. py runserver [127.0.0.1[:8000]]` ###### app `python3 manage. py startapp app` `python manage. py makemigrations` app model.py `python manage. py migrate` ##### 2.settings BASE_DIR INSTALLED_APPS app MIDDLEWARE CSRF,POST TEMPLATES DIRS: [os.path.join(BASE_DIR, 'templates')] STATIC_URL = '/static/' STATICFILES_DIRS = [ BASE_DIR, 'static') ] ##### 3.djangomysql ###### 1.mysql ###### 2.settings ```python DATABASES ENGINE django.db.backends.mysql NAME HOST IP PORT 3306 USER PASSWORD ``` ###### 3.pymysqlmysql \_\_init\_\_.py ```python import pymysql pymysql.install_as_MySQLdb() ``` ###### 4.appmodels.pymodel(models.model) ``` from django import models class User(models.Model): username = models.CharField(max_length=32) ``` ###### 5. ``` python3 manage.py makemigrations python3 manage.py migrate ``` ##### 4.urls.py ```python from app1 import views urlpatterns = [ path('admin/', admin.site.urls), path('list/', views.p_list), path('create/', views.create), path('delete/', views.delete), path('edit/', views.edit) ] ``` ##### 5. ```python def xxx(request): request.method # request.POST # post return # render(request, 'login.html', context={'info': 'Success'}) HTML # HttpResponse('') # redirect('/index') ``` ##### 6.ORM -> -> -> ###### ```python from app1 import models models.User.objects.all() models.User.object.get(id=1) models.User.object.filter(id=1,name='x') ``` ###### ```python models.User.objects.create(name='123') ``` ###### ```python models.User.objects.get(id=1).delete() models.User.objects.filter(id=1).delete() ``` ###### ```python obj = models.User.objects.get(id=1) obj.name = 'xxx' obj.save() ``` ##### 7. ``` return render(request, 'filename.html', context={'k':'1'}) html ``` ``` {{ k1 }} # {% for i in K %} {{ forloop.counter. }} {{ i.name }} {% endfor %} ```
